description: Conan and his friend Tebnar are made a tempting offer by the local merchant class of the wealthy seaport city of Shar in Zingara. They must find and chart a safe route through the treacherous waters to an island veined with gold and inhabited by ghastly, bloodthirsty Cannibals. The journey is perilous enough, but the strange creatures they encounter on the island and the events that follow are not at all what the Cimmenan expected. A new episode by Larry Yakata and Val Mayerik.
name: Isle of the Faceless Ones

description: Kindt's daring spy story is the backdrop for the unique tale of two sisters, their relationship, and the secrets they share. This World War II era spy thriller that spans not only the globe, but time as well, from England to Spain and from ancient Roman times through the era of Pirates and Buccaneers. An epic, 2 Sisters has everything - shady gypsies, mysterious rockets, buried treasure, pen-guns, cyanide teeth, and romance.
name: A Super-Spy Graphic Novel

description: Published by A Is A Comics.
name: 2-Headed Giant

description: The beast is loose in the City of Angels. It rampages from street to street, destroying some of L.A.'s most treasured landmarks that lay in its path. But as it smashes through the city many questions arise. What does it want? Where does it come from? Can anything stop it? But the biggest question of all: Is the world ready to learn the secrets of the Ymir? The highly classified scientific cabal of the military stands ready to catch the monster and prevent its most precious secret from leaking out at all costs. But is the genie already out of the bottle? This second installment of the Ray Harryhausen-inspired epic peels away a few layers of the mystery, only to learn that the true answers lie 20 million miles more.

With the Ymir recaptured after its citywide rampage, the depths of Project Five's murky tendrils are revealed, and the answers go back more than five decades. Fifty years of doubt, guilt, and anguish weigh heavy on former astronaut Bob Calder, as he is forced to confront ghosts from the past and enemies of the present. And as bizarre as his life has become since his granddaughter's horrid transformation into a Ymir monster, it's about to take another dark twist. This third installment of the 4-part mini-series will keep readers guessing as an important layer of the mystery is revealed!

To the naked eye, Venus is a bright pinpoint of light in the morning sky. Twenty million miles closer, the enigmatic planet is hidden beneath a thick cloud layer obscuring deadly secrets shrouded in mystery for millennia. In this final chapter of the Ray Harryhausen-inspired epic, man returns to Venus for the first time in 50 years. What awaits them is something as deadly as it is astonishing. What they find will change the future of humanity as they pierce the veil of secrecy that blankets the planet! Prepare for the frightening legacy of the Ymir!

Fast Track
It's the race of the year as Speedy Gonzales and The Road Runner finally face off! Unfortunately, it looks like Sylvester and Wile E. Coyote may be planning some dangerous detours!

 The Old Con Game
Duck Dodgers and Porky Pig in the 24th and a half Century discover the first annual Duck Dodgers Convention.

Sammy Come A-Courting
Yosemite Sam tries to hook up with a rich lonely widow.
name: Fast Track;  The Old Con Game;  Sammy Come A-Courting

description:
Proper Japanese Title: Gōsuto Airando no Bōken (ゴースト島の冒険)

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 441 - Duel on Banaro Island (バナロ島の決闘 "Banaro-Tō no Kettō")
  • Chapter 442 - Adventure in Demonic Sea (魔の海の冒険 "Ma no Umi no Bōken")
  • Chapter 443 - Thriller Bark (スリラーバーク "Surirābāku")
  • Chapter 444 - Adventure on Ghost Island (ゴースト島の冒険 "Gōsuto Airando no Bōken")
  • Chapter 445 - Zombies
  • Chapter 446 - Doctor Hogback (ドクトル・ホグバック "Dokutoru Hogubakku")
  • Chapter 447 - Zombie-in-the-Box (びっくりゾンビ "Bikkuri Zonbi")
  • Chapter 448 - Moria (モリア)
  • Chapter 449 - The Four Monsters of the Thriller Bark (スリラーバークの四怪人 "Surirābāku no Yonkaijin")
name: Adventure on Ghost Island

description: In the aftermath of last month's issue, there's nothing left for the survivors to do but pick up the pieces. Frank might have outsmarted Jigsaw for the time being, but at what price? And what comes next?
name: Jigsaw Part 5 of 6

description: Manhunter finds a shocking link between the disappearances of immigrant workers and big business – and that means attorney Kate Spencer's going to court, if she doesn't become a target first!
name: Forgotten Part 3: Found

description: A search for the magical well-springs of Aka-Gaar, fabled to renew youth and beauty sends Conan into the vast Nomadic Desert. Paid handsomely by Queen Yanna, the aging matriarchal ruler of Khemi, deceit and jealousy among those closest to her results in an illfated plot against him. The harsh elements, the unexpected occurences in the burning wasteland, and the strange waters of Aka-Gaar result in a brutal sojourn. Written by Larry Yakata and illustrated by Gary Kwapisz.
name: The Winds of Aka-Gaar

concept_credits.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

first_appearance_concepts.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

volume.name: The Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe: Master Edition

description:
Overview

It has all the makings of an epic adventure: an ancient artifact is rediscovered; a mask of unknown origins, with unforeseen power and magic. But who knew that after donning this mask even the wimpiest geek would become an indestructible shape-changing super-tornado with a mind for mischief and an appetite for destruction?

Equally adept with gun, knife, bat, bomb, pie, or bat-knife-gun-pie-bomb, a geek turned super-freak, The Mask cuts a crazed swath of cartoon mayhem!

Reprints/Collects

  • The Mask #0 (1991)
  • The Mask #1 (1991)
  • The Mask #2 (1991)
  • The Mask #3 (1991)
  • The Mask #4 (1991)
  • The Mask Returns #1 (1992)
  • The Mask Returns #2 (1992)
  • The Mask Returns #3 (1992)
  • The Mask Returns #4 (1992)
  • The Mask Strikes Back #1 (1995)
  • The Mask Strikes Back #2 (1995)
  • The Mask Strikes Back #3 (1995)
  • The Mask Strikes Back #4 (1995)
  • The Mask Strikes Back #5 (1995)
name: Volume 1

description:
Cover: Ben Oliver (Sinister Dexter)

  • Droid Life
  • Judge Dredd - Blindside (part 3) (Robbie Morrison - Richard Elson)
  • Nikolai Dante - Amerika (part 10) (Robbie Morrison - Simon Fraser)
  • Defoe - Book Two - Brethren of the Night (part 10 - final part) (Pat Mills - Leigh Gallagher)
  • Terror Tales! - Bitter Reflections (Nicolas Jean - Yann Valeani)
  • Sinister Dexter - The Importance of Fleeing Ernest (part 4) (Dan Abnett - Anthony Williams)
name: Prog 1598

description: What's the matter, bunky? Quagmire in the Middle East got you down? Economy in the toilet? Closest thing you've got to a social life these days is your MySpace page? Then have we got the miniseries for you! Laugh your troubles away with ARMY@LOVE: THE ART OF WAR, as Season Two of the wildly acclaimed satire by Rick Veitch (SWAMP THING) and Gary Erskine (THE FILTH) follows the raucous misadventures of a group of U.S. soldiers fighting the war that modern marketing says is winnable. This 6-issue miniseries provides the perfect entree into the comic book that Entertainment Weekly called 'amazingly racy and ruthless,' and that Variety said is 'full of the kind of wild ideas that comics used to do all the time.' It's more over-the-top sex, mayhem and human comedy that boingboing.net described as 'the kind of funny we need a lot more of if we're to keep from laughing ourselves into the grave.'
name: Monster Mash

description:
As we count down to the end of Season Zero, the untold back-story of the events leading up to the SCIFI mini-series is set to explode!

Written by Brandon Jerwa, with art by Jackson Herbert - who also provides the cover alongside a Galactica Photo Cover!

A woman in trouble, friends on the run from cops and mobsters, and a secret no one is prepared to face! All this and more await readers in the beginning of a hard-hitting new noir tale “Bad Night” Part 1 of 4, as CRIMINAL’s new expanded format keeps the hits coming! Five years ago, Jake was a happy family man, long-retired from the life of crime he grew up in, and then the police made him the prime suspect in a horrible crime and ripped his life apart. Now, years later, Jake is less than a shadow of his former self, a hopeless insomniac who walks the city streets at night. But one night, he walks into the wrong place at the right time, and his whole life changes again… For the better or the worse, is the question. And on top of this longer-than-usual length main story, CRIMINAL now features an expanded back-pages section, as well – with articles by Brubaker and other top crime writers, from novelists to screenwriters to comic writers. These noir articles have become a popular piece of the CRIMINAL package, and are something that can only be found in the comics, not in any collections. So don’t miss out on the start of a new story arc in the most acclaimed crime comic on the stands!
name: Bad Night Part One

description: A demon is loose in London, and where's John Constantine? On a beach in Ibiza with a mai tai and a Brazilian model. That leaves Chas alone to solve a bloody mystery - but when one of his old friends goes missing and a new friend emerges to turn his life upside down, saving the city is the last thing on Chas's overburdened mind.
name: The Knowledge, Chapter Two

description: In part 4 of the 5-part "Room and Boredom," things are going from bad to worse for our heroine Fig Keele – she's starting to believe that she may never actually escape from the House of Mystery, and that the people she's trapped with may be less friendly than they appear. But the greatest danger, she will soon realize, comes from the House itself.
name: Room and Boredom, Part 4: The Longing

description: Virgin Comics and Deepak Chopra present the story of Saraswati, she of the white swan, daughter of Brahma and the wise but temperamental goddess of wisdom and learning. In an ancient age ridiculed by his wife for his lack of intellectual finesse, a young man named Kalidasa embarks on a quest to achieve enlightenment. His prayers are answered as Saraswati blesses him with the wisdom of sages and prophesizes his destiny to be the greatest of all poets, yet lost in his youthful enthusiasm the young poet hastily composes a hymn in honor of the goddess marveling at not only her wisdom and prowess, but also her ethereal beauty. Miffed at this seeming affront the goddess puts a curse on Kalidasa that he shall lose his glib tongue in the holy city of Varansie.
name: Saraswati

description: The tumultuous year 1883 comes to a close with the final showdown between Smiling Jack Candle and the Sheriff without a Gun. Get the women and children off the streets and board up your doors and windows - there's gonna be a killin'!
name: 1883 - Chapter Three: The Showdown

first_appearance_teams.name: United States Department of the Treasury

team_credits.name: United States Department of the Treasury

description: All Jonah Hex wanted was some peace and quiet. He built a cabin in the woods, hoping to start a new life away from the lawless world. But what evil deed will call him back to action – and will he be able to escape his troubled past? Featuring a cover by Andy Kubert (BATMAN)!
name: Outrunning Shadows
Where Treads The Living Totem!

description: Ensnared in a game of international intrigue! Gambit runs afoul of a madcap crew known as A.S.K.E.W, while tracking mutant messenger, Courier. Introducing the Mengo Brothers, professional thugs of the Pig! Plus, what’s all this talk about a mind-controlling gas?
name: Monsters Like Us

description:
Don’t miss the prelude issue to Gambit’s first ongoing series! Gambit’s been hired out by the mysterious New Son to collect a ‘sigil’ from the High Evolutionary’s base in the Savage Land. Little does Gambit know…the ‘sigil’ is a human being!

After his trial, the X-Men had left Gambit without them in Antarctica. Fending for himself and trekking through the cold for days, Gambit had woken up for an unconscious state only to stumble upon the New Son. The New Son had explained that he worked for the people that had saved him from the cold. In return, he requested that Gambit go to the Savage Land and find the "sigil".

Once in the Savage Land, Gambit finds what he was looking for, a huge building built by the High Evolutionary. Once inside, Gambit fights with the many guards there, but manages to find the sigil, only to find out that it is actually a she. Gambit manages to capture her, but when he does, he falls dizzy and feverish. A green sentient substance is expelled from Gambit and reveals that she is what had protected Gambit from the Antarctic cold and climate for so long and in return he will do something for her. She goes back inside him.

Before leaving, the "sigil", also called Courier, goes to find a terraformer, a program similar to what was used to create the Savage Land. Upon finding this out, Gambit tried to stop Courier thinking that the program will only be used for bad.
name: Between Daze

description: The Sisters of the Forest Heart are elfin defenders of the most precious resource of their planet and they are paladin warriors. Sapphire, a lusciously beautiful new Sister learns that one of her Sisters has become a traitor intent on their destruction. She and her two cat-like magical creatures she has bonded to must counter this new threat! Gorgeously painted in full color, mixing fantasy adventure and creatures of all types in a lush sensuous series.
name: volume 1

description: Multiple Warhedz shows a dystopian future ruled by evil forces. Sexica and her half-werewolf boyfriend set out on a journay to leave behind thier dangerous home.
name: The Fall

person_credits.name: Brandon Graham
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: The Guangdong Factory is infested with monsters. It's up to Caesar and his superhero persona Sharknife to clean the place up.
name: Stage First

person_credits.name: Corey Lewis (Rey)
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: To take over her ninja clan, Itchy Koo needs to marry Jeremy Feeple, an ordinary high schooler at Quagmire High. At the same time, Princess Asrial of the the Royal Conglomerate is ordered to marry Jeremy...Includes the 6-page back-up story, "Arnie: Gives a Speech"
name: A New Student Comes to Quagmire High

description: While trying to solve a crime in Texas, Cassie is being targeted by many foes. Some Nef Lords of Hell, the police, thanks to Muffy's visions and now H.P. Lovecraft's Re-Animator. Sharp your axe Cassie if you want to survive what's coming.
name: Over the Rainbow

description:
Know this, reader of these texts-- Red Sonja has perished! Fallen in battle with the vile sorcerer Kulan Gath, Sonja gave her life to save all of Hyboria.

For a time, the red-maned warrior did journey through Hades at the side of the boatsman Charon. Here, she did learn the truth of her own creation at the hands of the false Goddess Scathach.

Twenty winters have passed since last Sonja walked the land. However, now that she has returned, her new incarnation self has yet to learn the truth of her existence, or the reason for her miraculous rebirth...
name: Red Sonja and the Pirates, Part 2

description: The bloody tale of World War II and Operation Olympus continues as the first U.S. Marines storm the beaches of Japan! But the Land of the Rising Sun will not consider surrender, and every man, woman and child is prepared to make the Americans pay for their impudence. The battle that could have been is only just beginning in this amazing alternate world epic!

Overview:

It's the moment of truth, as Supergirl struggles to do the impossible by fulfilling her promise to find a cure for a young boy's fatal illness. If she succeeds, she will change the course of history – and maybe not for the better! And if she fails, a child will die.
name: Time Heals All Wounds

description:
Spoilers

The issue starts as Swift is standing on top of a building in the ruins of London now called Unlondon. She explains how she now acts as a transmitter as all machines no longer work and birds flock to her due to destroyed or rearranged magnetic fields. As she flies over the ruined city she sees a lone balloon floating up in the air. She heads toward it finding Midnighter guiding a group of refugees. The group stops as both Midnighter and Swift talk. Soon Midnighter becomes panicked and tells everyone to go. Swift tries to get everyone to move the two disabled trains behind them are destroyed and Midnighter grabs a sharp piece of metal prepared to fight telling them not to look back. Soon to hulkish creatures charge at the group. Swift calls them Incubites. She says they are a result of a mutating disease called Warhol Fever. It gives the infected large muscular bodies and fills them with rage and anger, but it is only short lived as the disease soon kills the infected and that even Midnighter cannot survive contact with the virus. He throws the piece of metal through one of their mouths as the group runs and Swift soon takes for the sky trying to get specialist help. Midnighter then grabs a chunk of the railroad and stabs another through the chest as Swift struggles to fly through the poisonous cloud covering the planet. Soon as Midnighter prepares to fight a large group of Incubites a bright blast of light shines killing the Incubites. Soon a shining Apollo appears. He explains that Swift came to get him for help and soon his face is revealed to now look sickly and withered. Midnighter mentions he has been living in the photosphere. Swift explains it is the only place where he can absorb needed sunlight that can't get through the smog cloud. He soon has to leave as he can't even survive a few seconds under the cloud, but says he will be watching. Soon he tells Swift to go on ahead and inform the group that he is bringing the group. Soon she flies over more ruin till she reaches the dead body of the Carrier as it's baby universe was removed and it crashed into London. She flies through pacing groups of homeless now using the Carrier as a home as it is the only place relatively safe. She soon meets the Engineer however the EM pulses that shut down all machines have made her nanobots in active and in her human form. She seems to be using her intellect to manage and care for the people their telling Midnighter and Swift when they need to go for supplies seemingly acting as leader. As they talk a voice tell them that a soul storm is coming and Angie goes to get everyone ready. Soon Swift calls the voice Jack and it is revealed to be a deformed handicapped Jack Hawksmoor.
name: Chapter 1

description: The Man is scoping out the Mission as he fights to get inside to honor his pledge and aid Father Ramirez - who also juts happens to be Tuco's brother!
name: Sinners and Saints Chapter Three
The Girl of the Haunted Wood
At the Altar of the Goat God
There Will Come A Dark Stranger
The Blossoms of the Black Lotus

description: Conan and his men, the Zuagirs, pursue a king in order to loot his riches. The king intends to sacrifice a serving wench to the dark God Kah-Tah-Den but she fights back and escapes. The decapitating God kills some of Conan's men and is badly wounded. It causes a cave-in which finishes it off.
name: The Decapitating God

description: This is it! The final prequel issue before this summer’s upcoming Mummy blockbuster movie, starring Brendan Fraser! Twists and turns and cliffhangers aplenty as Rick O’Connell goes mano-y-mano—er, make that mano-y-mummy, against the rejuvenated, mythical ax-wielding god of thunder, Xango. What surprises are in store for our band of heroes? Will Rick and son Alex save the fate of humankind before Evie returns home and discovers their recent misadventures? Pulpy madness and the kitchen sink, brought to you by Joshua Jabcuga (Scarface: Devil in Disguise) and Stephen Mooney (Angel: After the Fall).

volume.name: The Mummy: The Rise and Fall of Xango's Ax

description: Carson finds his plane intact…and so do the other pilots! But that's not the biggest mystery facing the exiles from history! Plus, Carson defends Akisha, the woman from the future, against a rampaging prehistoric beast!
name: Divisions

description: Tor and his female companion fight their way back to the surface world, but their bloodthirsty pursuers haven't given up their plans for Tor – plans that involve ritual sacrifice! Can Tor survive in this strange, prehistoric world?
name: The Reckoning

person_credits.name: Joe Kubert
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
1. Wraparound cover by Ross Andru and Dick Giordano.
  2. Splash page by Dick Giordano.
  3. "The Werewolf of Krypton!" (Superman and Batman) written by Denny O'Neill, penciled and inked by Murphy Anderson, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda.
  4. "Encounter with a Dark Avenger!" (Green Arrow and Black Lightning) written by Dennis O'Neill, penciled by Dick Dillin, inked by Frank Chiaramonte, colored by Jerry Serpe and lettered by Ben Oda.
  5. "The Night the Cry Failed!" (Black Canary and Green Arrow) written by Gerry Conway, penciled by Jose Delbo, inked by Vince Colletta, colored by Jerry Serpe and lettered by Milt Snapinn.
  6. "Prey of the Harpies" (Hawkman, Hawkgirl and Superman) written by Steve Englehart, penciled and inked by Murphy Anderson, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda.
  7. "The Gamester's Death Wager!" (Captain Marvel and Mary Marvel) written by E. Nelson Bridwell, penciled by Don Newton, inked by Kurt Schaffenberger, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Milt Snapinn and Gaspar Saladino.

Notes:

  • 64 pages with no ads.
  • Bolo Arrow and Net Arrow used.
name: The Werewolf of Krypton! / Encounter with a Dark Avenger! / The Night the Cry Failed! / Prey of the Harpies / The Gamester's Death Wager!

description:
1. The Curse of the Hangman's Noose! (Superboy, Ma and Pa Kent, Jax-Ur, General Zod, Kru-El / written by Leo Dorfman)

2. The Runaway Superbaby! (Super Baby, Ma and Pa Kent / written by Leo Dorfman)
name: The Curse of the Hangman's Noose! ; The Runaway Superbaby!

description:
1. The Stolen Subway (Lois Lane, Superman, Perry White / written by Cary Bates : reprinted from: Superman's Girlfriend, Lois Lane #137)

2. The Building Is Dead (Lois Lane, Superman, Melba Manton / written by J. David Warner : reprinted from: Superman's Girlfriend, Lois Lane #137)

3. Babble, Babble, Toil and Trouble (Superman vs Mr. Mxyztpltk, with Steve Lombard / written by Elliot S! Maggin : reprinted from: Superman #290 (August 1975))

4. The Superman-Lois Hit Record (Superman, Lois Lane, Lana Lang, Perry White / written by Jerry Siegel : reprinted from: Superman's Girlfriend, Lois Lane #45)

5. Four Deaths for Lois Lane (Lois Lane, Superman / written by E. Nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Superman's Girlfriend, Lois Lane #50, 60, 102, 103, 115 and Superman Family #169)

6. Introducing Lonar (The Forever People / written by Jack Kirby : Reprinted from: The Forever People  #5)
Reprints the first appearance of Lonar

7. The Shadow from the Grave (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Lois Lane, Lucy Lane, Perry White, Melba Manton / written by Leo Dorfman : reprinted from: Superman's Pal, Jimmy Olsen #160)
name: The Stolen Subway

description:
Tin Tin kills Bea (an old woman) Ratso and Fat Eddie. 

The Crow meets up with Tin Tin to deliver revenge. He then stops by to pay his respects to Top Dollar, who after The Crow dispatches everyone else in the room tires to bargain for his life.  Just like Tin Tin is doesn't work.
 
The Crow relives the time he was known as Eric Draven and his love with Shelly Webster.  It goes through there romance until she is shot in the head while she is making love with Eric by the Skull Cowboy.
 
The Crow (Eric Draven)  reminisces about happier times with Shelly Webster, and when he presented her with the wedding ring that would play into the later parts of the story. Eric catches up with Skank and Tom Tom, from which he learns the location of the wedding ring at "Gideon's Pawn" Shop. 
 
He then goes to Gideon Resale and gets back Shelly's ring.  He also kills Gideon and blows up the pawn shop.  Not before however he talks with Albrect about his wife and tells Albrect to send a message to Captain Hook.
 
On his way to his next target Funboy he bumps into Sherri and gives her Shelly's engagement ring and tells her he is going to send her mother Sandy Skin back home.  He meets up with Funboy who is with Sandy and does at he promises and tells Funboy that they will meet at the Gin Mill.
 
The Crow battles Funboy's hoods at the Gin Mill.  He also remissness of his murdered love Shelly Webster.
 
This is the tale of the death of Shelly Webster and Eric Draven.  This is a flashback/Origin Story to the events before Eric Draven becomes the Crow.
 
The Crow gets his revenge on Funbot, T-Bird's Crew and finally T-Bird himself.  Before he can go on however he has to forgive.  Forgive himself.
name: The Crow

description:
Tweety and Sylvester - Electronicat - 4 pages (Copyright 1981)

Tweety and Sylvester - Quarantined - 6 pages (Copyright 1981)

Tweety and Sylvester - The World's Fastest Feline - 5 pages (Copyright 1981)

Tweety and Sylvester - Meating With Defeat - 4 pages (Copyright 1981)

Tweety and Sylvester - Hooligan's Island - 3 pages (Copyright 1981)

Tweety and Sylvester - Magic Madness - 5 pages (Copyright 1975)

Tweety and Sylvester - It's Okay, Chief - 5 pages (Copyright 1985)
name: Electronicat

description:
1. The Right Side (Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse : inside front cover)

2. High Tibet (Mickey Mouse, Goofy)

3. One Hundred Million Years Ago (Mickey, Minnie, Mortie, Ferdie)

4. Dog Wash Blues (Mickey, Pluto)

5. Toys in the Refrigerator (Mickey, Morty, Ferdie)
name: Walt Disney's Mickey Mouse in High Tibet

description:
1. Lady in Distress (inside front cover)

2. Mister Glamorous

3. Maestro Peter Perkins

4. Haircut

5. Going Out With Polly (inside back cover)

6. Tunnel of Love (back cover)
name: Andy Hardy Comics
